channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023100710
item.description:
Report E-2023100710

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: VALPARAISO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023, one (1) 337-gallon tote of UN3266 leaked approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior due to a loose lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100667
item.description:
Report E-2023100667

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN3266 ProClean Egg Wash release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8' x 9' area of the trailer floor and a 20' x 4' area of the concrete lot below the trailer floor due to a pallet puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and citric acid solution were utilized to clean and neutralize all impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100811
item.description:
Report X-2023100811

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Spill agent was dispatched to the non con area at the INDH facility for a cylinder on a wooden skid that contained UN1013. The spill agent was told that the skid had fallen off the belt. They observed that the cylinder was leaking from the valve and may have been damaged from the fall. Shipper was contacted for local pick up from the facility since there was not a gauge to determine if the cylinder was empty. System would not accept the cylinder specification markings DOT-TC3AAM-138

item.title: Report X-2023081039
item.description:
Report X-2023081039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INDH spill office was presented a fiberboard box with an odor. While investigating the shipment they discovered that the cap was loose on the plastic jerrycan inside. Contents were placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained to return the shipment to the shipper.
